meanings.sent1: The heavy rock was stithied in its place.
meanings.sent2: The old tree stood stithied in the middle of the field.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn door seemed stithied shut, refusing to open.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was stithied, unwavering in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins were stithied in time, preserving their history.

meanings.definition: Stithied (verb): to make something fixed or immovable
meanings.sent1: He stithied the fence post securely into the ground.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith stithied the metal into a strong blade.
meanings.sent3: The magician stithied the rabbit in the hat, making it disappear.
meanings.sent4: The architect stithied the foundation, ensuring the building's stability.
meanings.sent5: She stithied her resolve, ready to face any challenge ahead.
